data.title: Top 25 Passions Characters of All Time!
data.meta_description: Discover the top 25 Passions characters of all time! Celebrate the 25th anniversary of this captivating soap opera...
data.text:
Top 25 Passions characters of all time! In celebration of the 25th anniversary of Passions’ debut, we present the top 25 favorite characters of all time. Passions is an American television soap opera that captivated audiences from July 5, 1999, to September 7, 2007, and then on DirecTV’s The 101 Network from September 17, 2007, to August 7, 2008.

Crafted by the visionary screenwriter James E. Reilly and brought to life by NBC Studios, Passions immersed viewers in the lives, loves, and enthralling romantic and paranormal escapades of the Harmony residents. Set in a small town in New England teeming with secrets, the series revolves around the multi-racial core families: the African-American Russells, the distinguished Cranes and Bennetts, and the vibrant half-Mexican half-Irish Lopez-Fitzgeralds. Adding to the allure, the series incorporates Supernatural elements, primarily focusing on the enigmatic town witch Tabitha Lenox, portrayed by the talented Juliet Mills, and her captivating doll-come-to-life, Timmy, brought to life by Josh Ryan Evans.

See the top 25 below!

25. Vincent Clarkson

Vincent was a character portrayed by actor Phillip Jeanmarie. He was a mysterious, enigmatic, and complex individual who brought a significant amount of drama and intrigue to the show. His storyline involved various shocking twists and turns. Through it all he became a memorable character who is still talked about today in conversations surrounding the now defunct series.

24. Noah Bennett/Fancy Crane

Noah is the son of Sam Bennett and Grace Standish, and Fancy is the granddaughter of Alistair Crane. They were central characters in the show and were involved in various romantic and dramatic storylines throughout the series. The role of Noah was played by Dylan Fergus while Emily Harper played Fancy.

23. Simone Russell

Simone Russell was last played by Cathy Jeneén Doe. She was introduced as a friend of the show’s central characters, and she later became involved in various romantic storylines that brought the character at the forefront of the series. Simone was also played by Chrystee Pharis and Lena Cardwell.

22. T.C Russell

T.C. Russell was portrayed by actor Rodney Van Johnson and was known for being the patriarch of the Russell family, a devoted husband, and a respected community member in the fictional town of Harmony.

21. Jared Casey

Jared Casey was played by James Stevenson. He was introduced as a mysterious stranger who arrived in Harmony and eventually became involved in a romantic storyline with the character Theresa Lopez-Fitzgerald. Throughout the series, Jared’s true identity and motives were subject to various plot twists and revelations.

20. Edna Wallace

Edna Wallace was played by veteran, Kathleen Noone. She was like the ultimate terrible mom. At first, she used to be cool, but then she got into a lot of relationships, and there was a lot of unsurety who her kid’s father were. She didn’t care much about her daughter Beth, bringing home a bunch of boyfriends and making Beth suffer. Edna’s mission became to make Beth miserable in their tumultuous mother-daughter relationship.

19. Miguel Lopez-Fitzgerald

Miguel Lopez-Fitzgerald, played by Jesse Metcalfe at first, was like the ultimate heartthrob on the show. He was all about love and drama, especially with Charity Standish. Miguel came off as this sweet, romantic guy who sometimes didn’t quite get how the world worked. Family always came first for him, and his storylines were full of love pursuits, spooky stuff, and his constant mission to keep his loved ones safe. Other actors like Gerardo Celasco and Blair Redford also took on the role after Metcalfe left the show.

18. Chad Harris-Crane

Chad Harris-Crane was originally played by Donn Swaby. He was Whitney Russell’s best bud, but then bam! Plot twist: turns out he’s actually her half-brother, leading to all sorts of juicy drama with family secrets and love triangles. The character was also played by Charles Divins.

17. Beth Wallace

Beth Wallace was portrayed by Kelli McCarty. She was really good at being all sneaky and tricky, always mixed up in different plans and stuff. She was totally tangled up in the show’s crazy storyline, especially in her relationships with other characters.

16. Sam Bennett

Sam Bennett was portrayed by actor James Hyde. He was the chief of police in the town of Harmony and a dedicated family man. He was married to Grace Bennett and was the father of two daughters, Jessica and Kay. Sam was known for his sense of justice and his unwavering commitment to protecting the citizens of Harmony.

15. Kay Bennett

Kay Bennett was first brought to life by actress Taylor Anne Mountz. She was all about her wild love life and her part in all kinds of supernatural and magical stories. She was a known mischief maker and best friend of Simone Russell. Deanna Wright and Heidi Mueller also had their turn playing the character.

Top 25 Passions Characters of All Time!

14. Alistair Crane

Alistair Crane was played by John Reilly. He was the big boss of the rich Crane family and he was famous for being all sneaky and ruthless. His wicked plans and tricks always stirred up a lot of drama in the show.

13. Charity Standish

Charity Standish was played by Molly Stanton. She was known for being super kind and sweet, and for her romantic pairing with Miguel and all the crazy family drama. Throughout the show, Charity got caught up in all sorts of supernatural and dramatic situations, adding to the show’s unique and supernatural storylines.

12. Grace Bennett

Grace was portrayed by Dana Sparks. She was married to Sam Bennett and had three kids: Jessica, Kay, and Noah. Her character was all about being caring and devoted to her family. Grace even had a twin named Faith who was Charity’s mom.

11. Ivy Winthrop

Ivy Winthrop was played by actress Kim Johnston Ulrich. She was known for her manipulative and scheming nature, often causing trouble for other characters on the show. She was involved in various storylines including her relationship with Julian Crane and her rivalry with the character of Theresa Lopez-Fitzgerald.

10. Whitney Russell

Whitney Russell was played by Brook Kerr. She was the daughter of T.C and Eve. She was besties with Theresa and had pairings with Fox and Chad, the latter of which was a very dramatic pairing throughout the series.

9. Gwen Hotchkiss

Gwen Hotchkiss Winthrop, portrayed by Liza Huber, was all about the drama on the show. She had these complicated relationships and was always caught up in some wild schemes, often teaming up with her sneaky mom, Rebecca. Gwen was also played by Natalia Zea.

8. Eve Russell

Eve Russell was played by actress Tracey Ross. She was a big deal in the soap opera, famous for her messy relationships and intense storylines. She was married to T.C and had a secret past with his rival Julian Crane, which eventually came out.

7. Rebecca Hotchkiss

Rebecca Hotchkiss was portrayed by Andrea Evans. She was all about the money, pulling strings, and getting mixed up in all the show’s crazy drama. Her sneaky ways and tricky plans definitely made her a character you wouldn’t forget, and not everyone in Harmony was a fan of her—that’s for sure.

6. Luis Lopez-Fitzgerald

Luis (played by Galen Gering) was a central character on the show. He was portrayed as a kind-hearted and brave man who often found himself entangled in dramatic and tumultuous relationships, particularly with Sheridan Crane. The character was known for his strong sense of justice and his unwavering determination to protect his loved ones. Throughout the series, Luis was involved in various storylines, including mysteries, conflicts, and romantic entanglements.

5. Julian Crane

Julian, played by Ben Masters, was a big shot on “Passions.” He was shown as this slick and sly member of the rich Crane family, always up to no good. Julian found himself mixed up in all sorts of juicy dramas, like secret flings, family power fights, and shady business. His twisted and morally murky character really stole the spotlight in the series.

4. Ethan Winthrop

Ethan Winthrop (played by Travis Schuldt/Eric Martsolf) was a prominent character on the show. He was portrayed as a lawyer who became involved in various romantic and dramatic storylines, including a love triangle with Theresa Lopez-Fitzgerald and Gwen. Ethan was depicted as a principled and honorable figure, often caught in the midst of family secrets and conflicts.

3. Tabitha/Timmy

Tabitha (played by Juliet Mills) was this super powerful witch who used her magic to bend everyone in the made-up town of Harmony to her will. Timmy (played by Josh Ryan Evans), on the other hand, was this real-life doll she conjured up with her magic! Even though he started off all obedient and stuff, Timmy ended up developing a really strong sense of what’s right and became this lovable character on the show. The storyline with Tabitha and Timmy added such a quirky and fun vibe to the story, making them totally unforgettable in the “Passions” world.

2. Sheridan Crane

Sheridan Crane on “Passions” was a central character portrayed by actress McKenzie Westmore. She was the daughter of powerful businessman Alistair Crane and became involved in a tumultuous love story with Luis Lopez-Fitzgerald, creating one of the show’s most iconic couples. Sheridan was known for her resilience, compassion, and her frequent entanglement in the drama surrounding the Crane family.

Theresa Lopez-Fitzgerald

Theresa was a central character on “Passions,” played by Lindsay Hartley. She was portrayed as a strong-willed and passionate woman who often found herself entangled in romantic and familial dramas. Despite facing numerous challenges, Theresa remained determined and resilient, making her a memorable and beloved character on the show. Her most famous word was probably “fate”. And as “fate” would have it, Theresa is in the number one spot on this top 25.

Who would have been your top 25 Passions characters of all time?
